definition: arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
to fight/to combat/to seize/(of heart) to beat

sentences.english: He clipped an electronic pulse reader tohis finger.
sentences.chinese: 他把电子脉搏计夹到手指上。

sentences.english: To assess the effectiveness of cardiac compressions during adult cardiopulmonary resuscitation, the nurse should palpate which pulse site?
sentences.chinese: 心肺复苏时，评估按压的有效性，应检查哪处的脉搏？

sentences.english: To get a pulse, I put my finger in a bullet hole.
sentences.chinese: 我把手指摁在子弹孔上，还有一丝脉搏的迹象。

sentences.english: Deception Point is pulse-pounding fiction at its best.
sentences.chinese: 《大骗局》是让脉搏狂飙的登峰造极之作。

sentences.english: The novel throbs with the pulse of our times.
sentences.chinese: 这部小说把握了我们时代的脉搏。

sentences.english: The term "quickening" refers to the rising pulse rate during the second stage of labor.
sentences.chinese: 术语“胎动”定义为分娩的第二产程期间加快的脉搏。

sentences.english: Landing headfirst in the water, he felt his pulse quicken.
sentences.chinese: 一头栽倒在水中后，他感觉到脉搏加快。

sentences.english: Result:The effect on health can be found in the measurement of fingertip-pulse waves.
sentences.chinese: 结果指端脉搏波能反映健身效果。

sentences.english: Disclosed is an automatic sounding and counting instrument for pulse which is a medical apparatus suitable for feeling the pulse in traditional Chinese medical treatment.
sentences.chinese: 脉搏自动发声计数仪是一种适于中医切脉的医疗器具。

sentences.english: Your pulse lulls the tympans of my ears.
sentences.chinese: 你的脉搏令我耳鼓难安。

sentences.english: Her face was pale and her pulse could not be felt clearly.
sentences.chinese: 病人的脸色苍白，脉搏也摸不太清。

sentences.english: Continuous use of a quantitative monitor of oxygenation such as pulse oximetry is HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.
sentences.chinese: 强烈建议使用连续的定量氧合监测器，如脉搏血氧仪。

sentences.english: I ran over and checked his pulse.
sentences.chinese: 我跑过去检查他的脉搏。

sentences.english: Let me feel your pulse. I'll take your blood pressure.
sentences.chinese: 让我试试脉搏，再给你测个血压。

sentences.english: The WHO has now developed a follow-on initiative to advance the idea of Global Oximetry.
sentences.chinese: WHO同时也在倡议推动全球脉搏氧监测仪的理念。

sentences.english: In this paper, a pulse signal detector is developed based on the working principle of sphygmomanometers.
sentences.chinese: 本文讨论了一种脉搏波传感装置。

definition: condition or type of pulse (in Chinese medicine)
to throb/to pulse/to bounce/to jiggle/to jump about
arteries and veins/vein (on a leaf, insect wing etc)
